content: 1 the snowbird snuggle scarf by aimzstiches amy brucker 2026 @aimzstitches 2 description the snowbird snuggle scarf is a classic cozy long scarf knit in the round creating a fabric with no wrong side an i-cord fringe is worked at both ends for a playful polished finish this pattern is highly customizable to your gauge and is designed to help you use up every gram of your yarn materials us 10 5/6 0 mm 16 circular needles spare needle us 10/6 5 mm or smaller for stitch rearranging optional a cordsmith for making the i-cord fringe not required but very helpful https //byautumn com/cordsmith/ alternatively you may use double-pointed needles to work the i-cords gauge 12 stitches x 14 rounds = 4 inches / 10 cm in stockinette in the round size finished dimensions 10 x 82 inches / 26 x 208 cm after blocking excluding the fringe this scarf is easily customizable to your preferred length note that increasing the length will require additional yarn you may also adjust the width of the scarf ensure your total stitch count is a multiple of 3 to accommodate the i-cord fringe yarn 600 meters / 656 yards of sport to bulky weight yarn the sample shown was knit using sewrella yarn woolly base 164 yd / 50 g a 90% superwash merino wool / 10% recycled nylon blend with a soft fluffy texture although categorized as a sport-weight yarn it knits up at a bulky-weight gauge any yarn that produces a fabric you enjoy at gauge will work well using a thicker worsted or bulky yarn will result in a denser heavier fabric amy brucker 2026 @aimzstitches 3 pattern cast on 66 stitches using a 16 in / 40 cm us 10 5 6 5 mm circular needle join to work in the round being careful not to twist knit stockinette in the round for approximately 272 row or until your work measures 78 inches / 198 cm from the cast-on edge or to your desired length your scarf may grow in length after blocking depending on the fibers used note you can make your scarf any length you like i used 4 skeins total approximately 3 5 skeins for the stockinette tube and the remaining yarn for the i-cord fringe for a straight edge finish instead of fringe graft both ends of the tube closed using kitchener stitch weave in ends and block as desired make the fringe on the cast-on edge pick up 66 stitches evenly along the cast-on edge place 33 stitches onto one needle front needle and the remaining 33 stitches onto a second needle back needle using a third needle alternately slip one stitch from the front needle and one stitch from the back needle onto the third needle to close the tube and form a flat edge 66 stitches are now on one needle we will now work 3-stitch icords across the flat edge 1 knit the first 3 stitches on the needle 2 slip
